title: ChimeChat
text: ChimeChat R package streamlines cross-species ligand–receptor (L–R) analysis paired human mouse bulk RNA-seq datasets. automates: Mapping mouse genes human orthologs VST transformation human mouse raw counts (via DESeq2) Merging species unified gene expression matrix Ligand–receptor scoring Statistical testing Heatmap visualization L–R pairs

code: library(ChimeChat)  # Step 1: Merge and VST ChimeData <- run_ChimeDB(   human_file = "Human_CountData.xlsx",   mouse_file = "Mouse_CountData.xlsx" )  # Step 2: LR scores LR_scores <- get_ChimeLRscore(   combined        = ChimeData$combined,   direction       = "mouse_ligand_human_receptor",   db_scope        = c("secreted","contact","ecm"),   rename_to_mouse = TRUE,   ortholog_map    = ChimeData$ortholog_map )  # Step 3: Statistics stat_results <- get_ChimeStatistics(LR_scores)  # Step 4: Heatmap run_ChimeHeatmap(LR_scores, stat_results, n_top = 20)

title: Step 2: Build a ligand–receptor (LR) table and compute LR scores — get_ChimeLRscore
text: combined numeric matrix (rows = human gene symbols) returned run_ChimeDB(). direction Direction scoring: "mouse_ligand_human_receptor" "human_ligand_mouse_receptor". db_scope Character vector c("secreted","contact","ecm") select CellChatDB categories. rename_to_mouse Logical; TRUE, convert mouse-side gene names display. ortholog_map list data.frame used map human--mouse names (typically run_ChimeDB()$ortholog_map). rename_mode Display mode multiple orthologs exist: "one" (first ) "compact" (first plus “+n ”).

title: Step 2: Build a ligand–receptor (LR) table and compute LR scores — get_ChimeLRscore
text: tibble columns: direction Scoring direction. ligand Ligand gene symbol. receptor Receptor gene symbol. score Sum VST-transformed ligand receptor values. condition Condition label (Control/Treatment). sample Sample identifier. pair_human Pair shown human symbols sides. pair Display pair, one side renamed mouse symbols requested.

Step 3: Perform a per-pair t-test (Treatment vs Control) with multiple-testing correction — get_ChimeStatistics
text: lr_scores data frame get_ChimeLRscore(), containing least: pair: Ligand–receptor pair identifier. score: Numeric score sample. condition: Condition label ("Control" "Treatment"). direction (optional): Interaction direction, applicable. adjust_method Method p.adjust (default "fdr"). by_direction TRUE lr_scores contains direction, adjust p-values separately within direction.

title: Step 3: Perform a per-pair t-test (Treatment vs Control) with multiple-testing correction — get_ChimeStatistics
text: tibble one row per pair (per direction present), including: direction: Interaction direction (present). pair: Ligand–receptor pair identifier. p.value: Raw p-value t-test. t: t-statistic t-test. mean_Treatment: Mean score Treatment samples. mean_Control: Mean score Control samples. delta: Difference mean_Treatment - mean_Control. n_Treatment: Number Treatment samples. n_Control: Number Control samples. p.adj: Adjusted p-value multiple-testing correction.

what: Step 1: Map mouse -> human at raw-count level, VST per species, then merge — run_ChimeDB
title: Step 1: Map mouse -> human at raw-count level, VST per species, then merge — run_ChimeDB
text: Reads two raw count tables (columns: Control_1..3, Treatment_1..3, symbol). First, mouse gene symbols mapped representative human symbols (one2one preferred, otherwise highest %id) mouse counts aggregated per human symbol raw-count level. DESeq2 size factors VST computed separately (mapped) mouse matrix human matrix. Finally, union genes taken matrices merged.

code: run_ChimeHeatmap(   lr_scores,   stat_results,   n_top = 20,   fdr_thr = 0.05,   pair_column = c("pair", "pair_human"),   sample_order = c(paste0("Control_", 1:3), paste0("Treatment_", 1:3)),   cluster_rows = TRUE,   cluster_cols = FALSE,   scale_rows = TRUE,   palette = "RdBu",   palette_n = 100,   palette_rev = TRUE,   breaks = NULL,   fontsize_row = 12,   fontsize_col = 12,   border_color = "white",   show_rownames = TRUE,   ... )

title: Step 4: Heatmap of top ligand–receptor (LR) pairs using pheatmap — run_ChimeHeatmap
text: lr_scores Data frame get_ChimeLRscore(). stat_results Data frame get_ChimeStatistics() (must contain pair, p.adj, t, delta). n_top Integer. Number top pairs plot (default 20). fdr_thr Numeric. FDR threshold used prefer significant pairs (default 0.05). pair_column LR-pair column lr_scores use: "pair" (display) "pair_human" (sides human symbols). sample_order Character vector. Desired column order heatmap. Columns listed appended specified order. Default: c(paste0("Control_", 1:3), paste0("Treatment_", 1:3)). cluster_rows Logical. Cluster rows? (default TRUE) cluster_cols Logical. Cluster columns? (default FALSE) scale_rows Logical. TRUE, row-scale scores (.e., scale="row") (default TRUE). palette Brewer palette name (default "RdBu"). palette_n Integer. Number colors interpolate (default 100). palette_rev Logical. Reverse palette? (default TRUE). breaks Optional numeric vector breaks passed pheatmap. NULL, symmetric breaks computed; scale_rows=TRUE, centered scheme [-2, 2] used default. fontsize_row Numeric. Row font size (default 12). fontsize_col Numeric. Column font size (default 12). border_color Border color (default "white"). show_rownames Logical. Show row names? (default TRUE). ... Additional arguments passed pheatmap::pheatmap().

title: Step 4: Heatmap of top ligand–receptor (LR) pairs using pheatmap — run_ChimeHeatmap
text: list three elements: pairs — Character vector plotted pairs (order used). matrix — Numeric matrix (pairs × samples) used plotting. plot — pheatmap object (invisibly returned pheatmap).

title: Step 4: Heatmap of top ligand–receptor (LR) pairs using pheatmap — run_ChimeHeatmap
text: Pair selection logic: pairs meet FDR threshold, take top n_top ascending p.adj (ties broken |t|). Else pairs finite p.adj, take top n_top ascending p.adj. Else fall back top n_top descending |delta|.
